subject: Re: [junit] Custom Runner Delegation
msgSnippet: Gabriel, ... Yes, it would, and the current implementation should--there s even a passing test that says it does.  Hmm... Could you simplify and post a failing
messageBody:
Gabriel,

On 1/10/07, gabrielcooper <gabriel.cooper@...> wrote:
> What runner should it use if none is specified in the subclass? The
> default "TestClassRunner" or the parent class's "MyCustomRunner"?
>
> Currently it uses the default runner rather than its parents' custom
> one. Would it make sense to have runners be inherited from their parents?

Yes, it would, and the current implementation should--there's even a
passing test that says it does. Hmm...

Could you simplify and post a failing test to help us figure out the
problem you're having? Thanks,

David Saff
